content: this egg-shaped raccoon amigurumi crochet pattern is an easy quick and cute crochet pattern for easter while some crochet experience is recommended if you know basic crochet stitches colour changing and how to crochet in the round - you ll be able to make this adorable little raccoon the crochet pattern is available for free on my blog here 1 however if you d prefer the ad-free version as a pdf download this can be purchased from my ravelry store ## materials needed ## * **yarn ** dk chenille yarn i recommend using sirdar happy chenille in the following colours light purple 12 grams = 31m/34yds dark purple 2 grams = 5m/5 5yds and white 1 gram = 2 5m/2 8yds * **crochet hook ** 2 5mm or 2 75mm/b or c in us * **other materials ** stuffing needle scissors pins stitch marker 6mm safety eyes white embroidery thread/dk yarn black embroidery thread ## raccoon size ## using the yarn and hooks specified in this pattern my creation was 5cm/1 96 wide by 8cm/3 high ## gauge ## gauge is not required for this pattern however keep gauge consistent throughout for reference my gauge was 5 single_crochet stitches on 2 5cm / 1″ 5 row on 2 5cm / 1″ ## additional information ## * **pattern language ** english * **pattern terms ** us terms * **level ** easy * **stitches used ** magic_ring single_crochet increases and decreases * **yarn ** the yarn choice is completely up to you and you can change the yarn weight material and colours based on your own personal preference just be aware that the weight of your yarn may impact the hook size you need to use and also the size of your final make * **hook size ** i recommend using a smaller hook size than recommended on the yarn label this will stop the stuffing from appearing through your stitches * **eyes ** please note that safety eyes are a choking hazard and are not suitable for children under 3 years of age as an alternative consider embroidering the eyes instead * **working in rounds ** all parts within this pattern are worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise stated * **stitch marker ** use a stitch marker at the beginning of each round/row to keep track of the number of stitches * **no-sew elements ** some body parts are attached to the body as you crochet as a result i recommend crocheting the feet and tail before you crochet the body the no-sew technique is explained clearly throughout the pattern * **copyright ** you are more than welcome to sell your crocheted creations using this pattern on a small scale however the pattern itself cannot be reproduced sold or redistributed in any way without the designers consent for more information please read the full copyright notice at the bottom of this page ##
